ONE Institute interview with Bob Basker (1 of 3) July 1, 1996

Physical Description: video VHS

Scope and Contents note

July 1, 1996, tape one: childhood through 1945; NYC, Harlem Renaissance, JUGGS, military service. Original 8mm video cataloged as "Vid/Potvin015".

Physical Description: video VHS

Scope and Contents note

July 1, 1996. tape 2: lovers of, drag parties in NYC, married '50-'60, Civil Rights Movement, Midwest Mattachine, Florida Mattachine, MCC, politics. Original 8mm video cataloged as "Vid/Potvin016".

ONE Lecture December 7, 1986

Physical Description: video VHS

Scope and Contents note

Filmed on December 7, 1986 at ONE Institute. Gene Touchet, Ph.D., Dean of Graduate School and Head of Dept. of Literature and the Arts at ONE, discusses attitudes of homosexuals toward homosexuality throughout history by reading from Greek poetry (Stratas?), Elizabethan drama (Marlowe), modern plays (Tennessee Williams, Larry Kramer), and modern poetry (Dennis Cooper, Allen Ginsberg).-- description from notes left with video

Institute for the Study of Human Resources: Agenda for 1981 Annual Meeting: Opening session: Directors, Trustees, Invited guests; Call to order - President Laud Humphreys; Minutes and financial report - Secretary-Treasurer Dorr Legg; Past president - Reed Erickson (1964-1979); Education report - Dwain Houser and Dorr Legg; Discssion: Response to education report - Jesse Jacobs, President ONE; Public session: Introduction of guests; Special gifts to the foundation - Librarian David Moore; Janus information faculty report - Dr. Paul Walker, San Francisco; The bibliography project - Professor Wayne Dynes, New York; Election of officers for 1981; Summary - Laud Humphreys 1981
